alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:13PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 713 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eagle Nest Lake State Park, or 21 miles northeast of Taos, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cimarron, Eagle Nest, Cimarron Canyon State Park, Eagle Nest Lake State Park, Ute Park, Philmont Scout Ranch and Rayado. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 278 and 310. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands
